messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the Spring Boot 2.x framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/api/paste/{paste_id}` with method GET, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `src/main/java/com/urcodebin/api/controllers/CodePasteController.java`, `CodePasteController#getCodePasteFromId` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/api/paste/{paste_id}` with HTTP method GET.

2. In `src/main/java/com/urcodebin/api/controllers/CodePasteController.java`, `CodePasteController#deleteCodePasteWithId` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/api/paste/{paste_id}` with HTTP method GET.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a dict of Response Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].responses) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins" (I will split your output and then do json parse, so you must output it and do not change it), followed by the dict of Response Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

I will first analyze the code paths and determine the possible HTTP responses for GET /api/paste/{paste_id}. Then I will inspect the project files (using shell commands) to determine the structure of CodePasteDTO so I can inline the response schema without using $ref. Finally, I will present the explanation and then output the required JSON under the exact delimiter "the final generated result begins".
Tool call limit reached. Tool call run_command not executed. Don't try to execute it again.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.
